intro: Pochota sordida, commonly known as the sordid pochota, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy, woody pods that open to release the seeds. Pochota sordida is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool, temperate climates.
